news.title: As Anthropic tries to keep pace with OpenAI, it's also taking on the U.S. government
news.summary: Anthropic is chasing OpenAI in the artificial intelligence market. David Sacks, the White House AI and crypto czar, has been publicly critical of Anthropic.

news.title: The alleged 'sweeping betrayal of trust' that rocked Zions bank and spooked Wall Street
news.summary: Zions Bancorporation lost $1 billion of its valuation in a single day on Thursday after disclosing $60 million worth of loans it had made that were unlikely to be repaid.

news.title: From fraternities to women's soccer, this under-the-radar T-shirt brand is popping up everywhere
news.summary: Comfort Colors is a half-century-old, Gildan-owned shirt brand. A loyal and growing base of consumers are driving demand for the brand.

news.title: Top Wall Street analysts are upbeat on these 3 dividend-paying stocks
news.summary: Three dividend-paying stocks highlighted by Wall Street's top pros. Here are three dividend- paying stocks, highlighted by Wall Street'sTop pros.

news.title: I retired in the No. 1 country Americans want to move to most—I don't regret it: 'We save about $5,000 per month'
news.summary: When he was 41, Alex Trias walked away from a high-paying law career. Now he lives in Portugal, the No. 1 country Americans want to move to the most.

news.title: There’s one key piece of chart evidence missing to call for a stock-market correction
news.summary: Despite concerns that a stock-market correction is imminent, repeating patterns of success by bulls show the uptrend is still intact — for now.

news.title: ‘My family is having a crisis’: My mom added my brother to her mortgage. He stopped paying. How does she get him off it?
news.summary: “He refuses to take their names off the mortgage without getting paid,” says a source close to the family. “He doesn’t want to pay them. He wants them to get paid.”

news.title: ‘It’s getting scary close to retirement’: We’re 70. We have no debt, no stocks and $275K in savings. Are we in trouble?
news.summary: “We will have $4,300 a month in Social Security,” he says. “That’s what we’ll be able to do.”

news.title: ‘She may have a spending problem’: Would it be wrong to secretly give our son money — without telling his wife?
news.summary: “Our son and his wife, who are in their 30s with a child in preschool, are having marital problems,” his mother said. “Our daughter-in-law, who is in her 30s, is having marital issues,’ she said.

news.title: I’m 42, a single parent with $372K in cash and CDs. I won’t invest in stocks. Am I wrong?
news.summary: “I am not comfortable putting too much cash in stocks, especially given I have two young kids,” he said. “I’m not comfortable put too much money in stocks.”
